intro: Boechera gracilipes, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Boechera gracilipes is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
